<state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Sorting and searching of audit records may be based upon the contents of audit record fields, for example: (i) date/time of events; (ii) user identifiers; (iii) Internet Protocol (IP) addresses involved in the event; (iv) type of event; or (v) event success/failure.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PII (to include PHI):  To conduct efficient and effective remediation of loss of sensitive information, such as a breach of personally identifiable information (PII), it may be necessary to tailor the organization of the audit report or to provide search functionality with audit reports that are generated. For example, if the PII breach involves only one or two users it may be most efficient to sort the audit report by user ID or to provide the ability to search on user ID within the audit report.
